title: Add storage and management of child biometric/touch-sensing data (guardian-controlled)

requirements.text: Add backend data models and stable-state storage to associate "biometric data" and/or "touch-sensing data" records with a specific child profile, with guardian-only authorization for create/read/delete operations.

quotes: This app should store biometric data or touch sense of child

acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores one or more data records per childProfileId in canister state so data persists across upgrades (using the project’s existing state patterns).
Only guardian/admin callers can add, view, list, or delete stored biometric/touch-sensing records; non-guardian callers receive an authorization error.
APIs exist to: (1) add a record for a child profile, (2) list records for a child profile, (3) delete a specific record, and (4) delete all records for a child profile.
Backend validates the referenced childProfileId exists and is not archived before accepting new records.

requirements.text: Implement frontend UI in the Guardian Dashboard to manage stored biometric/touch-sensing data per child profile, including adding a new record, listing existing records, and deleting records (guardian-only).

quotes: This app should store biometric data or touch sense of child

acceptanceCriteria: A new guardian-facing section is available from the existing dashboard (e.g., under the Profiles tab or a new tab) to manage biometric/touch-sensing records per child profile.
Guardian can select a child profile and add a new record (with clear labeling of the data type: “biometric” vs “touch-sensing”).
Guardian can view a list of records for the selected child profile, including at minimum: record type and created timestamp.
Guardian can delete individual records and can delete all records for a child profile, with a confirmation step before destructive actions.
All data operations are wired via React Query mutations/queries and the UI shows loading and error states (toast or inline).

requirements.text: Update user-facing copy to remove existing claims that the app does not collect/store biometric data, and instead accurately describe what biometric/touch-sensing data is stored, who can manage it, and the web-app limitations around device-level touch detection.

quotes: This app should store biometric data or touch sense of child

acceptanceCriteria: The Limitations & Privacy page (frontend/src/pages/LimitationsPrivacy.tsx) no longer states “This app does NOT collect, store, or process any biometric data.”
The Limitations & Privacy page clearly states (in English) that this is a web app and still cannot perform automatic device-level touch detection outside the browser context.
The Landing page marketing bullet “Uses device authentication without collecting biometric data” is updated to reflect the new behavior accurately (in English).
All updated text is consistent across pages and does not claim capabilities the app does not implement (e.g., no claim of OS-wide touch monitoring).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; do not introduce additional backend services.
Do not edit files in frontend immutablePaths (compose existing UI components instead).
All user-facing text must be in English.
Do not claim or implement OS-level/system-wide touch detection; only store data explicitly provided within the web app UX.
Because this app concerns children under 13, ensure the UI copy presents clear guardian responsibility and does not imply regulatory compliance guarantees.
nonGoals: Implementing real biometric recognition or matching/identification algorithms.
Capturing fingerprint/FaceID/TouchID data from the device (Internet Identity/WebAuthn does not expose biometrics to the app).
Implementing native mobile capabilities or background/system monitoring.
Integrating third-party biometric providers or external databases.
